paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Threonine60Alanine, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: 61 year old male of Irish ancestry
patients.phenotype: Familial Amyloidotic Polyneuropathy with post-transplant restrictive cardiomyopathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive restrictive cardiomyopathy following liver transplantation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Subsequently, it was learned that the patient's mutation was on the transthyretin (TTR) gene, Threonine60Alanine.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with amyloid deposition leading to cardiac dysfunction.

variants.additional_notes: The patient had no prior cardiac symptoms before liver transplantation.
key_quotes: He was subsequently diagnosed with an accelerating post-transplant restrictive cardiomyopathy due to amyloid infiltration.
Subsequently, it was learned that the patient's mutation was on the transthyretin (TTR) gene, Threonine60Alanine.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
